title: Artificial General Intelligence
summary: Artificial general intelligence (AGI) is a type of artificial intelligence that would match or surpass human capabilities across virtually all cognitive tasks. Some researchers argue that current large language models already exhibit signs of AGI-level capability, while others maintain that genuine AGI has not yet been achieved. Unlike narrow AI, an AGI system can generalize knowledge, transfer skills between domains, and solve novel problems without task-specific reprogramming. Creating AGI is a primary goal of AI research companies like OpenAI, Google, xAI, and Meta. A 2020 survey identified 72 active AGI research projects across 37 countries. The timeline for achieving human-level intelligence AI remains deeply contested, with recent surveys of AI researchers giving median forecasts ranging from the late 2020s to mid-century.
